questions.question: What is the main goal of Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)?

answers.c: To understand the underlying patterns in the data

explanations.a: While machine learning is important, EDA is more about exploring and understanding the data first.
explanations.b: Cleaning and preprocessing are part of data preparation, but EDA focuses on exploration.
explanations.c: Correct! The main goal of EDA is to understand the patterns, trends, and anomalies in the data.
explanations.d: Statistical analysis can be part of EDA, but the primary focus is data exploration.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common method for visualizing data in EDA?

explanations.a: Bar plots are commonly used in EDA for categorical data.
explanations.b: Heatmaps are used to visualize correlation matrices and patterns in EDA.
explanations.c: Box plots are often used to identify outliers and the distribution of data.
explanations.d: Correct! All of these are common methods used in EDA.

questions.question: Which of the following would you most likely check during the EDA process?

explanations.a: Correct! In EDA, you would check the data types of features to understand the structure of the data.
explanations.b: Model accuracy is typically checked after building a model, not during EDA.
explanations.c: Hyperparameter tuning is part of model optimization, not EDA.
explanations.d: The train-test split happens after EDA when you are preparing data for model building.
